disc: Neutropenic sepsis is a medical emergency. It is a predictable complication of bone marrow disorders and cytotoxic chemotherapy. Patients are vulnerable to invasive infection which can lead to septic shock and death. In addition to securing the airway, breathing and circulation the next crucial step in management is the prompt administration of empirical antibiotics. Intravenous broad-spectrum antibiotics are preferred in addition to crystalloids.
